page.title: 03OCCUPATIONS IN CROSTON
page.content: The table of house types in Croston shows that since 1972 there has been a much bigger demand for detatched rather than semi-detatched housing. This fact suggests that Croston is being used as a{dormitory settlement. One of the reasons for the daily exodus is the{limited work}in the village itself.There are{four small {firms}concerned with timber or joinery and their total workforce is about sixty, whilst the largest single firm is a{small textile mill}with about seventy employees. Apart from these industries, the main sources of employment in the village are the{shops and offices.}They consist of the following: 11 Food shops,1 Post Office,1 Chemist 1 Clothes shop,2 Hairdressers,3 Banks 1 Newsagents,1 Building Society, 2 garages and 3 Builders Yards.
